snippet: The Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman said the two countries had “14 communications” last week, but diplomats in Beijing said they knew of no substantive talks.
abstract: China and Vietnam appear to have reached at least a temporary impasse over giant drilling rig sent by state-controlled Chinese oil company to site in South China Sea between Vietnam coast and cluster of disputed islands; confrontation continues to raise thorny issues of international law.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing, Thomas Fuller from Bangkok, and Chau Doan from Hanoi, Vietnam.

lead_paragraph: The Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman said the two countries had “14 communications” last week, but diplomats in Beijing said they knew of no substantive talks.

headline.main: China and Vietnam at Impasse Over Rig in South China Sea
headline.print_headline: China and Vietnam at Impasse Over Rig in South China Sea
